description: Sliced potatoes that are typically deep fried. The dish can also be baked.
name: French fries

description: Fried pork rinds
name: Chicharrón

description: A type of banana fritter; sliced saba bananas, and sometimes other fruit slices, are put into in a spring roll wrapper, rolled in sugar, and deep-fried
name: Turon

description: A patty made with gram flour is deep-fried; usually served as a sandwich, sometimes with a side of crocchè (mashed potatoes and egg, covered in bread crumbs and fried)
name: Panelle

description: Meat and vegetables baked inside shortcrust pastry dough; pasties are particularly associated with Cornwall in England
name: Pasty

description: A steamed fish dumpling with vegetables served in peanut sauce. Considered a light meal that is similar to the Chinese dim sum. A popular street food, sold by cart or bicycle food vendors.
name: Siomay

description: Steamed or boiled silkworm pupae which are seasoned and eaten as a snack[c]
name: Beondegi

description: A ring-shaped bread roll similar to a bagel, but somewhat larger, denser, and sweeter.
name: Bublik

description: Wheat noodles, grilled with various ingredients such as vegetables and chicken or pork, and coated with a slightly sweet, savory sauce.  It is often served on a plate or in a bowl.  Sometimes served in a bun similar to a hot dog bun.
name: Yakisoba

description: Italian snacks consisting of a ball of rice (generally risotto) with tomato sauce and raw egg, typical of Roman cuisine.
name: Supplì

description: The intestines of a sheep or goat, placed on a skewer, flavored with parsley and onions, and cooked on an open grill It is one of the most common street foods in Palermo, Sicily.
name: Stigghiola

description: A spicy tofu dish food from Cirebon, a port town in West Java, Indonesia. It is served with a thin and watery dressing that is made by blending palm sugar, vinegar and sweet soy sauce.
name: Tahu gejrot

description: Grilled fatty pork over a plate of white rice noodles and herbs with a side dish of dipping sauce
name: Bun cha

description: A pork sausage wrapped in a buckwheat pancake
name: Galette-saucisse

description: A soft pudding made from tofu; depending on what is added to it, douhua can be either savory or sweet
name: Douhua

description: Grilled chicken skewers. The meat is first cooked and cut into narrow slices, then it is coated with barbecue-flavor spices. Mayonnaise and mustard may also be used as toppings.
name: Dak-kkochi

description: A savory fried pancake made of rice flour, water, and turmeric powder, stuffed with slivers of fatty pork, shrimp, diced green onion, and bean sprouts
name: Bánh xèo

description: Meat (often veal mixed with lamb) cooked on a vertical rotisserie; usually served wrapped in a flatbread with salad and condiments
name: Doner kebab

description: Masa (a corn-based dough made from hominy), combined with various savory ingredients and spices, steamed in a corn husk; the wrapping is discarded before eating
name: Tamale

description: A savoury fishcake delicacy from Palembang, Indonesia, made of the mixture of fish and tapioca dough. Served with yellow noodles and a dark, rich sweet and sour sauce called kuah cuka (lit. vinegar sauce).
name: Pempek

description: Deep-fried balls of ground chickpeas (or sometimes fava beans), often served with salad and tahini sauce in pita or a wrap
name: Falafel

description: A braided ring-shaped bread that is boiled and sprinkled with salt, poppy seeds, sesame seeds, etc., before being baked
name: Obwarzanek krakowski

description: Indonesian fried rice with aromatic, earthy and smoky flavor of caramelised sweet soy sauce and powdered shrimp paste. Served by street vendors, in warungs and also by travelling night hawkers that frequent residential neighbourhoods with their wheeled carts.
name: Nasi goreng

description: A Korean-Mexican fusion dish consisting of Korean-style fillings, such as bulgogi and kimchi, placed on top of small traditional Mexican corn tortillas.
name: Korean taco

description: Prepared by frying potatoes in oil and adding spices and chutney
name: Aloo chaat

description: Various foods cooked in a hot pot of spicy soup; the ingredients are on skewers that are selected by the customer
name: Malatang

description: A street food in Peru, where it is considered to be a national dish.
name: Ceviche

description: A corn tortilla that is filled with black bean paste and refried, then topped with turkey or chicken, lettuce, avocado, and pickles
name: Panucho

description: Deep-fried and coated in caramelized brown sugar; after cooking they are served on skewers
name: Banana cue

description: Large fillets of batter-fried whitefish served with square-cut or chunky chips (i.e. French fries)
name: Fish and chips

description: A traditional pastry resembling a thin, small round or square-shaped cake, usually filled with a soft cheese such as Urdă or apples.
name: Plăcintă

description: A type of fried cheese sandwich that is prepared by frying mozzarella cheese between slices of bread
name: Carrozza

description: A sandwich similar to a torta, with beef or sometimes chicken on a bun or baguette, and condiments and sauces of the buyer's choice
name: Pepito

description: Spicy coconut omelette, made from glutinous rice cooked with egg and served with serundeng (fried shredded coconut), fried shallots and dried shrimp as topping. Popular street food in Jakarta, Indonesia.
name: Kerak telor

description: A pastry made by wrapping dough around a stick and roasting it over an open flame, then sprinkling it with sugar and cinnamon; sometimes it is served with additional toppings
name: Trdelník

description: Frozen, sweetened milk and/or cream, often combined with fruits or other ingredients and flavors
name: Ice cream

description: Various meats and vegetables cooked, and sometimes served, on skewers
name: Brochette

description: Mozzarella cheese, chopped tomatoes, and béchamel sauce, placed between two round pieces of puff pastry and baked; rustico originated in the Salento region of Italy
name: Rustico

description: A hot and sour soup made with catfish and rice noodles; often eaten for breakfast It is considered to be a national dish of Myanmar.
name: Mohinga

description: A deep-fried burrito
name: Chimichanga

description: Hamburger-like sandwich made from white bread and a half-inch slice of thick baloney like sausage, diced sweet onion, chopped pickled cucumber, ketchup and mustard.
name: Porilainen

description: Fried cheese balls or sticks.
name: Malakoff

description: A type of meat-filled sandwich; the bread is similar to a baguette but airier and with a thinner crust; various fillings are used, most commonly some kind of pork or chicken
name: Bánh mì

description: Small pieces of meat that have been grilled, often on a skewer over charcoal
name: Kebab

region: Middle East, North Africa, and elsewhere
description: Balls or small patties of minced or ground meat—usually beef, chicken, lamb, or pork—mixed with spices and onions
name: Kofta

description: Fresh grains of corn are first boiled in salted water, then sautéed in butter with onions, chile peppers, and spices; the result is served hot in small cups and topped with lime juice, chile powder or hot sauce, salt, and mayonnaise
name: Esquites

description: A ring-shaped pastry made with deep-fried flour dough, with frosting, glazing, or a sweet filling
name: Doughnut

description: A cold dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice, evaporated milk, and various other ingredients—for example, caramelized plantains, jackfruit, tapioca, sugar palm fruit, coconut, sweet potato, boiled kidney beans, and flan
name: Halo-halo

description: A deep-fried pastry with meat filling; known in Russia as a belyash
name: Peremech

description: Cockles that are roasted and then served with olive oil and seasonings
name: Roasted cockles

description: Breakfast items such as scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, and cheese, wrapped inside a flour tortilla; invented in Santa Fe, New Mexico
name: Breakfast burrito

region: Middle East, Central Asia, Pakistan, India
description: A stew made with wheat, barley, lentils, and lamb or other meat
name: Haleem

description: A type of baked bread product made from dough most commonly shaped into a twisted knot.
name: Pretzel

description: Deep-fried catfish served with traditional sambal chili paste, often served with fried tempeh and steamed rice. Usually sold in street-side humble tent warung.
name: Pecel Lele

description: A vegetarian sandwich of a deep-fried potato patty on a bun, garnished with coriander and other spices
name: Vada pav

description: A deep fried snack made with rice, urad dal and other spices
name: Punugulu

region: United States (New York City), and before that, Belarus, Ukraine, Lithuania, Poland, and Jewish communities from former Pale of Settlement
description: A baked turnover of dough with any of various fillings, such as potatoes or ground beef
name: Knish

description: A mashed potato patty coated with chickpea flour, then deep-fried and served hot with chutney; a thick sphere, around two or three inches in diameter
name: Batata vada

description: French fries topped with döner or shawarma meat, grilled with a layer of Gouda cheese until melted, and then covered with a layer of dressed salad greens; often served with garlic sauce and sambal hot sauce
name: Kapsalon

description: A type of chaat made with puri (an unleavened deep-fried bread), chickpeas or potatoes, chili powder, and chutney
name: Dahi puri

description: A large dumpling filled with chicken broth and pork
name: Tangbao

description: Pieces of marinated pork or other meat, grilled on skewers
name: Ražnjići

description: A thin, flat pancake filled with sweet custard cream, or sometimes with a savory filling like pork or sausage, and then rolled into a cylinder.
name: Khanom Tokyo

description: A pastry that is formed in the shape of human feces; it is filled with red bean paste with walnut kernel
name: Ttongppang

description: A type of very thin pancake. A very common street food in Paris, France.
name: Crêpe

description: Czech potato pancake and it is made of grated potatoes with egg, breadcrumbs or flour and seasoning (salt, pepper, most importantly garlic and marjoram; sometimes ground, cracked or whole caraway seeds) and is served as it is.
name: Bramborák

description: A deep-fried flatbread, served with various toppings such as sour cream and grated cheese
name: Lángos

description: A small pizza that can range in size as a finger food at around three inches in diameter to that of a small personal-sized pizza.
name: Pizzetta

description: Chicken noodles of seasoned yellow wheat noodles topped with seasoned diced chicken meat (ayam). It is a popular street food in Indonesia, sold by travelling food cart.
name: Mie ayam

description: A large sandwich with any of various meat fillings and other flavorful ingredients, served on a telera or similar bread; often eaten at lunch time It is a common street food in Mexico City, Mexico.
name: Torta

description: Slices of sweet potato deep fried with a coating of caramelized brown sugar; sometimes served on a bamboo skewer
name: Camote cue

description: Small pieces of meat, usually pork, grilled on a skewer; served either in a pita wrap or on a plate
name: Souvlaki

region: Morocco and elsewhere in the Maghreb
description: A deep-fried food similar to a doughnut.  It is made with sticky, unsweetened dough, and usually sprinkled with powdered sugar.  Traditionally it is eaten for breakfast or at tea time.
name: Sfenj

region: Caucasus, Central Asia, Russia, Ukraine, Turkey
description: A deep-fried turnover with a filling of ground or minced beef or mutton with onions and spices
name: Chiburekki

region: Middle East, Southern to Southeastern Asia
description: A stuffed pancake or pan-fried bread made from minced meat (beef or chicken, sometimes mutton) along with garlic, egg and onion, and is eaten with curry or gravy.
name: Murtabak

description: A tortilla that is filled with cheese (and sometimes other ingredients) and grilled
name: Quesadilla

description: Pork meat wrapped in glazed puff pastry and baked
name: Sausage roll

description: A sandwich of chopped meat, traditionally braised pork, that has been stewed in a soup containing many spices, and served on a bun; it originated in Shaanxi Province
name: Roujiamo

description: Brand name for a deep-fried food similar to an egg roll, with a thick, chewy dough wrapper stuffed with mutton, barley, cabbage, carrots, celery, rice, and seasonings.
name: Chiko Roll

description: Small pieces of meat (traditionally beef heart) that are marinated in vinegar and spices, grilled, and served on a stick. Originated in Peru and is now common throughout South America.
name: Anticucho

description: Pita stuffed with fried eggplant and hard-boiled eggs, with salad and sauces such as tahini, hummus, and mango chutney
name: Sabich

description: Consists of a wheat flour tortilla wrapped or folded into a cylindrical shape to completely enclose various fillings that are used
name: Burrito

description: A sandwich of various ingredients on a bread roll, heated on a press or contact grill
name: Panini

description: A spicy soup with rice noodles and usually either fish, prawns, or chicken; many different variations exist, with most based either on rich and spicy curry coconut milk or on slightly sour tamarind
name: Laksa

description: A turnover made with pastry dough and any of various savory fillings, usually including some kind of ground or chopped meat; most often it is baked but sometimes it is fried
name: Empanada

description: Chicken is first soaked in a spicy marinade that commonly includes allspice berries, Scotch bonnet peppers, thyme, scallions, and fresh ginger; then it is smoked over charcoal at a high temperature, resting on top of green logs of allspice wood, and under a metal cover
name: Jerk chicken

description: Thick corn tortillas that are stuffed with various fillings, such as pork, chicken, refried beans, and/or cheese; often served with curtido, a lightly fermented cabbage relish
name: Pupusa

description: A ball-shaped snack made of a wheat flour-based batter and cooked in a special moulded pan. It is typically filled with minced or diced octopus, tempura scraps, pickled ginger, and green onion.
name: Takoyaki

description: Prepared many different ways in various regions; in some countries they are sold as street food; for example, in the Philippines, kwek kwek are hard-boiled quail eggs that are covered with an orange-colored batter and deep-fried
name: Quail eggs

description: A large sandwich of churrasco (grilled, thinly-sliced filet mignon) on a roll, with mozzarella, lettuce, tomatoes, mayonnaise, and other ingredients such as bacon, ham, and eggs
name: Chivito

description: An open-face sandwich made of half a baguette or other long roll, topped with sautéed white mushrooms, cheese, and sometimes other ingredients, toasted until the cheese melts, and served with ketchup
name: Zapiekanka

description: An unleavened flatbread made with atta (a finely-ground whole wheat flour); when making roti (sometimes known as chapati) the dough is heated on a flat griddle
name: Roti

description: A chicken that is marinated and then grilled over charcoal; the marinade typically includes fish sauce, garlic, turmeric, coriander root, and white pepper.
name: Kai yang

description: A thick vegetable curry served with a soft bread roll
name: Pav Bhaji

description: A type of tomato and cheese pie; very thin pizza dough is covered with tomato sauce and grated cheese, folded over a number of times, and baked
name: Scaccia

description: Corn on the cob, grilled and then coated with condiments such as butter or mayonnaise, salt, chili powder, añejo cheese, and lime juice; sometimes served on a stick
name: Elote

description: A slice of cheese (which is usually Edam, but may also be Hermelín) about 1.5 cm thick is first breaded with flour, egg, and bread crumbs and then fried either in a pan or deep-fat fryer. It is often served accompanied by a side salad, potatoes (fries or boiled potatoes), and, typically, tartar sauce. The dish may also be prepared with a thin slice of ham inserted between two slices of cheese, and in Czech fast food outlets it is often served in the form of a sandwich – in something similar to a hamburger bun.
name: Smažený sýr

description: A sweet snack made by pouring batter through a device into hot cooking oil in a circular pattern and letting it deep-fry, then sprinkling it with powdered sugar
name: Funnel cake

description: Bread stuffed with flavorful cheese and an egg
name: Khachapuri

description: There are several kinds, including the Brussels and the Liège.
name: Belgian waffle

description: Egg-shaped balls of cooked, mashed plantains stuffed with a mixture of refried black beans, chocolate, and cinnamon, deep-fried and served with powdered sugar or honey on top.
name: Rellenitos de Plátano

description: A hand-sized dish containing largely diced or minced meat and gravy, sometimes with onion, mushrooms, or cheese and often consumed as a takeaway food snack.
name: Meat pie

description: A round, hollow puri (a type of bread), fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water (pani), tamarind chutney, chili, chaat masala, potato, onion and chickpeas.
name: Panipuri

description: A corn tortilla rolled around a filling and covered with a chili pepper sauce. Enchiladas can be filled with a variety of ingredients.
name: Enchilada

description: Heavily spiced, barbecued foods on skewers
name: Shaokao

description: A flat dough fried or deep-fried in oil, shortening, or lard and generally leavened with baking powder
name: Frybread

description: A type of chaat (a savory snack) made with puri (an unleavened, deep-fried bread), potatoes, onions, several types of chutney, and sev (small pieces of crunchy noodles made from chickpea flour)
name: Sev puri

description: A deep-fried tofu from Sumedang, West Java.
name: Tahu sumedang

description: A type of chaat made with crushed puri (a type of fried bread) mixed with peas and masala (various spices)
name: Masala puri

region: Trinidad and Tobago/Caribbean with Indian influence
description: It is a sandwich made with two baras (flat fried bread) filled with curry channa (curried chick peas). Topped with either mango (aam), shadon beni (bandaniya), cucumber (kheera), coconut (naariyal), tomato (damadol), or tamarind (imalee) chutney, or extra pepper sauce. This delicacy is the most popular fast food in Trinidad and Tobago. Eaten for breakfast, sometimes for lunch, often at night but can be a late night snack, too.
name: Doubles

description: Individual-sized baked or fried buns stuffed with a variety of fillings.
name: Pirozhki

description: Rice noodles which are stir-fried with eggs and chopped tofu, and flavored with tamarind pulp, fish sauce (nampla น้ำปลา), dried shrimp, garlic or shallots, red chili pepper and palm sugar, and served with lime wedges and often chopped roast peanuts.
name: Pad Thai

description: Saba bananas cut into thin slices, coated with batter, deep-fried, and then sprinkled with sugar
name: Maruya

region: Italy, and elsewhere in Europe and North America
description: A thinly rolled bread dough crust, topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and other ingredients such as small pieces of meat and vegetables, and baked in an oven
name: Pizza

description: A corn or flour tortilla, with any of various fillings
name: Taco

description: A salad made with a mixture of fruits, vegetables, and savory spices
name: Rojak

region: Central Asia, Middle East, South Asia
description: Rice cooked in a seasoned broth, and various additional ingredients are sometimes used. Mussels filled with rice is a common street food in Istanbul, Turkey.
name: Pilaf

description: A fritter made from deep fried urad dal (black lentil) batter; it is usually made in a doughnut shape, with a crispy exterior and soft interior
name: Medu vada

description: A sandwich of melted cheese on toasted bread; many variations exist, but originally it was made by heating buttered bread and slices of American cheese in a skillet
name: Grilled cheese sandwich

description: Small bite-sized portions of food served in small steamer baskets or on small plates
name: Dim sum

description: Square pastries filled with cheese and chunks of ham
name: Jambon

region: Israel, by way of the Balkans
description: Baked puff pastry dough or filo dough with any of various fillings such as cheese, spinach, or potatoes
name: Boureka

description: Hard-boiled chicken eggs covered with an orange-colored batter and deep-fried
name: Tokneneng

description: Its principal ingredients are squash and sweet potato, and it is served in a doughnut form and covered with syrup, made from chancaca (solidified molasses). It is traditional to serve picarones when people prepare anticuchos, another traditional Peruvian dish.
name: Picarones

region: Eastern and Central Europe, Central and Western Asia
description: Pieces of marinated lamb or other meat, grilled on skewers
name: Shashlik

description: A spicy soup of meat and vegetables; many variations exist
name: Soto

description: French fries and cheese curds topped with a light brown gravy
name: Poutine

region: Nepal, Bhutan, Northeast and Northern India
description: A hot dumpling from the Himalayas that can be steamed or fried. Often eaten with garlic chutney
name: Momo

description: Small pieces of beef, chicken, or other meat, grilled on skewers; usually served with hot sauce on the side
name: Espetinhos

description: A fried turnover filled with mozzarella cheese, tomato sauce, and other pizza ingredients
name: Panzerotti

description: A turnover of pizza dough stuffed with pizza ingredients such as mozzarella and ricotta cheeses, tomato sauce, and sausage
name: Calzone

description: Chicken livers, gizzards, and hearts that are braised with various spices and then grilled; served either on a plate or as a sandwich in pita bread
name: Jerusalem mixed grill

description: A covrig is a baked, twisted piece of dough similar to a pretzel; it is usually topped with sesame seeds, poppy seeds, and/or salt
name: Covrigi

description: Grilled with coconut milk, sugar, and pandan leaf
name: corn

description: A dish consisting of rice vermicelli woven into intricate bundles and often topped with chopped scallions or garlic chives sauteed in oil, served with a complementary meat dish.
name: Bánh hỏi

description: A fluffy waffle made with eggy leavened batter cooked between two plates of semi-spherical cells; usually served plain
name: Egg waffle

description: Rice noodles and egg noodles, with prawns, pork or chicken, egg, bean sprouts, and other ingredients; served with soy sauce and sambal chili pepper sauce.
name: Hokkien mee

description: Al pastor is a dish developed in Central Mexico, likely as a result of the adoption of the shawarma spit-grilled meat brought by the Lebanese immigrants to Mexico. Being derived from shawarma, it is also similar to the Turkish döner kebab and the Greek gyros.
name: Tacos al pastor

description: A vegetarian dish from Jakarta, Indonesia, consists of tofu, vegetables and rice cake, rice vermicelli served in peanut sauce.
name: Ketoprak

region: Poland (Jewish communities originally), then New York City and other locations
description: A ring-shaped bread roll made with dough that is boiled in water for a short time and then baked; the result is a dense, chewy interior with a browned and sometimes crisp exterior
name: Bagel

description: A thick noodle that can be made from tapioca flour or a mixture of rice and tapioca flour,[a][b] it is used in several dishes.
name: Bánh canh

description: A cooked patty of ground beef, served on a bun or roll, often with toppings such as lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and ketchup.
name: Hamburger

description: Finnish blood sausage traditionally eaten with lingonberry jam, usually bought and eaten fresh at market stalls.
name: Mustamakkara

description: Pieces of saba banana on a stick, brushed with margarine, sprinkled with sugar, and grilled over charcoal
name: Ginanggang

description: A very large, dense corn tortilla, with refried beans, asiento (rendered lard), and Oaxaca cheese, some kind of meat such as pork or chicken, and various toppings often including salsa and guacamole; served either flat of folded in half
name: Tlayuda

description: A hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with curry
name: Bunny chow

description: A corn tortilla wrapped around various fillings and then fried
name: Taquito

description: A skewer-roasted kebab or other meat, wrapped in a paratha or other bread
name: Kati roll

description: Chicken intestines that are cleaned, boiled, put on a skewer, and grilled over charcoal; they are served with a dipping sauce of either spiced vinegar or barbecue sauce
name: Isaw

description: Stuffed rice balls coated with bread crumbs and then deep fried; they are usually filled with ragù (meat and tomato sauce), mozzarella, and peas
name: Arancini

description: Chopped veal spleen and lungs, boiled and then fried in lard, served on a soft bread called vastedda
name: Pani ca meusa

description: Melted cheese inside a thin dough-based wrap which has been breaded and then deep-fried
name: Kaassoufflé

description: Chicken pieces that are deep-fried with coriander, garlic, fish sauce, pepper, and other spices
name: Fried chicken

description: A grilled dish of spiced meat patty mixture of pork, beef and lamb.
name: Pljeskavica

description: A savoury snack, bhelpuri is a type of chaat made from puffed rice, vegetables and a tangy tamarind sauce.
name: Bhelpuri

description: A noodle soup of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat
name: Pho

description: A dish of Indian Chinese cuisine, made with fried noodles, sautéed vegetables, onions, and spices.
name: Chinese bhel

description: Dumplings with a ground meat and/or vegetable filling wrapped in a thin piece of dough; they are often steamed but they can also be fried or boiled
name: Jiaozi

description: Peeled beans formed into a ball and then deep-fried in dendê (palm oil)
name: Acarajé

description: A vegetable or fruit dish that is pickled with brine or vinegar
name: Asinan

description: A sausage of beef or pork, grilled, split lengthwise, and served on a roll with various condiments
name: Choripán

description: A slow-cooked, savory stew made with meat, poultry, or fish together with vegetables, fruit, and/or nuts; it is cooked in a large clay pot
name: Tajine

description: A type of fritter. Many varieties are sold on traveling carts by street vendors. Various kinds of ingredients are battered and deep fried, such as banana, tempeh, tofu, oncom, sweet potato, cassava chunk, cassava flour, and breadfruit, and these are often eaten accompanied by fresh bird's eye chili.
name: Gorengan

description: A savoury vegetarian dish made of stir fried tauge (bean sprouts) with slices of tofu, ketupat or lontong rice cake and yellow noodle, served in spicy oncom-based sauce.
name: Tauge goreng

description: A sausage typically made with pork and veal, and usually seasoned with ginger, nutmeg, coriander, or caraway; recipes for the sausage vary by region
name: Bratwurst

description: Meat (usually lamb and/or veal, or chicken) cooked on a vertical rotisserie; served in pita or a similar bread wrap, or on a plate, often with tahini sauce and other condiments
name: Shawarma

description: Skewers of charcoal grilled chicken seasoned with tare sauce
name: Yakitori

description: A thin, unleavened pancake or crêpe of chickpea flour originating in Genoa and later a typical food of the Ligurian Sea coast, from Nice to Elba island.
name: Farinata

description: Baked in large rectangular trays and cut into rectangular slices which are sold by weight
name: Pizza al taglio

description: A type of pizza with a thick, soft crust topped with tomato sauce, onions, caciocavallo cheese, and anchovies
name: Sfincione

description: A wide variety of different food items are served on skewers. The customer selects the skewers they want, which are then cooked in boiling oil or water.  A variety of dipping sauces are also provided.  At the end the customer pays based on the number of color-coded skewers.
name: Lok-lok

description: A savoury and spicy dish made of wet krupuk (traditional Indonesian crackers) cooked with protein sources (egg, chicken, seafood or beef) in spicy sauce.
name: Seblak

description: Dough covered with tomato sauce and topped with anchovies, black olives, onions, and garlic, baked in an oven; sardenara is similar to focaccia or pizza
name: Sardenara

description: Godamba roti (a type of flatbread) is chopped up and mixed with chicken or beef, eggs, and spices; the mixture is grilled, and garnished with onion, chili peppers, and other spices
name: Kottu

description: A pastry that contains various fillings and spices baked inside a flaky shell
name: Meat patty

region: India (Northern), Pakistan, and elsewhere in South Asia
description: A type of savory snack; a mixture of ingredients, it often includes fried dough, potatoes, chickpeas, chutney, and tangy spices
name: Chaat

description: A deep-fried fritter made from small balls of tapioca and potatoes, and flavored with peanuts, coriander, and chili powder
name: Sabudana vada

description: A fried patty of ground lentils, chicken or beef, egg batter, and spices, served on a bun with chutney on the side
name: Bun kebab

description: Ice cream served on an edible cone-shaped pastry that is somewhat similar to a thin, crispy waffle; this allows the ice cream to be eaten without a dish or utensils
name: Ice cream cone

description: A fried pork sausage topped with curry ketchup and curry powder, served either whole or cut up, sometimes with French fries on the side
name: Currywurst

description: A flat, round, unleavened patty of soaked, ground kernels of maize (or maize meal or flour) that can be grilled, baked, fried, boiled or steamed
name: Arepa

description: The proventriculus (part of the digestive system) of a chicken, breaded with corn starch and deep fried; served either in a small bagful of vinegar, or skewered on bamboo sticks to be dipped in the vinegar just before it is eaten; sometimes served with puso rice dumplings
name: Proben

description: A fried snack made with bread slices, gram flour, and spices; sometimes it is stuffed with mashed potatoes
name: Bread pakora

description: Basmati rice and potatoes, flavored with turmeric and other spices; a type of vegetarian biryani
name: Tahri

description: A flatbread similar in style, composition, and texture to pizza dough, topped with cheese, herbs, and other ingredients
name: Focaccia

description: Fried fish dumplings, usually served with peanut sauce. An abbreviation which literally means fried tofu and meatballs; it's a variant of siomay in which the dumpling is deep-fried instead of steamed.
name: Batagor

description: Meat (generally lamb, pork, and/or beef) cooked on a vertical rotisserie; usually served wrapped in a flatbread such as pita, with cucumber, tomato, onion, and tzatziki sauce.
name: Gyro

description: With batter-fried whitefish and other ingredients such as guacamole and salsa
name: Fish taco

description: Traditionally prepared using crisp fried dough wafers known as papri, along with boiled chick peas, boiled potatoes, yogurt and tamarind chutney and topped with chaat masala and sev.
name: Papri chaat

description: A fluffy bread roll with an egg in it
name: Gyeranppang

description: Made with soft dough and green onions; they are cooked by being fried in oil
name: Scallion pancake

description: Pork, prawns, vegetables, thin rice noodles, and other ingredients wrapped in a thin wrapper made from rice flour; similar to spring rolls, sometimes called "summer rolls"
name: Gỏi cuốn

description: A soup with meatballs, noodles, and other ingredients; the meatballs are commonly made from finely ground beef with a small quantity of tapioca flour and salt, however bakso can also be made from other ingredients, such as chicken, pork, fish or shrimp
name: Bakso

description: A snack made out of boiled potatoes, onions and various spices
name: Aloo tikki

description: A porridge of rice and shredded chicken, served with soy sauce, spices, fried shallots, cakwee (fried dough), krupuk (a type of cracker), and sambal (a hot sauce); often eaten for breakfast
name: Bubur ayam

description: Chopped or shredded chicken meat covered in dough, molded into a shape resembling a chicken leg, battered, and fried
name: Coxinha

description: A sausage, usually made with beef and/or pork, grilled or steamed and served in a sliced bun with mustard and other condiments
name: Hot dog

description: A wrap that is usually filled with typical döner kebab ingredients or other types of Turkish kebab.
name: Dürüm

description: A dish of seasoned, skewered and grilled meat, usually served in peanut sauce. A popular street food throughout Southeast Asia; from Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore and Thailand. Pork version is popular in Thailand.
name: Satay

description: Raw tuna or other fish, marinated in lime or lemon juice, mixed with vegetables such as cucumber, tomato, and scallion, with coconut milk poured over it; poisson cru means "raw fish"; the dish is also known as ʻota ʻika
name: Poisson cru

description: A hot dog wrapped in bacon, either deep-fried or grilled, often sold by unlicensed vendors.
name: Danger dog

description: Small, round dumplings made from fish paste (fish that has been made into a paste, either by fermentation or by physical pounding)
name: Fish balls

description: A hot dog on a stick, coated with cornmeal batter and deep fried.
name: Corn dog

description: Small pastries that are shaped like chrysanthemum flowers and filled with red bean paste
name: Gukhwappang

description: A sweet made with pastry and a filling of dates, usually infused with the flavours of aniseed and bay leaf, that is then deep fried
name: Imqaret

description: A deep-fried triangular turnover filled with vegetables (especially potatoes) or meat
name: Samosa

description: Small pieces of meat on skewers roasted over charcoal or deep frying in oil. Was traditionally made from lamb but chicken, pork, beef, and various types of seafood can also be used.
name: Chuan
